column4: hey I got a textbook question here I can't figure out :P "Under what condition will a file created by 'root' be automatically owned by the user called 'nfsnobody'?" .....I can't find the answer, can someone helP?
depending on the nfs mount options, requests coming from remote systems as root are treated as though they came from user nfsnobody....
the idea is that you don't want root users on clients to have unrestriced access to your filesystem
